data.title: Jennifer Lopez on Marc Anthony and Nadia Ferreira: What's their relationship like?
data.meta_description: Co-parenting is very important for separated couples who have already moved on with their lives. This is also the case for Jennifer Lopez and Marc Anthony, who share twins Emma and
data.text:
Co-parenting is very important for separated couples who have already moved on with their lives. This is also the case for Jennifer Lopez and Marc Anthony, who share twins Emma and Max.

Lopez married Ben Affleck last year and the couple are now in search of a new house, where they can all move in together. As for Affleck, he shares kids Violet, Seraphina and Samuel with his ex-wife Jennifer Garner.

According to ET, all of the four parents are "very involved" in their children's lives, while Lopez maintains a "healthy" relationship with Anthony's current partner, Nadia Ferreira.

"Their families are continuing to mesh well together, and their kids are getting along for the most part," a source told ET.

"They know they live a very privileged life and are grateful for all the opportunities they're given.

"[Lopez] always wants what's best for [Anthony]. She's happy for Marc and [his new wife] Nadia [Ferreira], and he feels the same about Jen and Ben

"[All four parents] do their best to reiterate how important it is to be appreciative and ensure that they're all taken care of and feel loved and supported."

Talking to Vogue about the relationship between her and Affleck's kids, Lopez stressed that the two families co-exist happily together.

"They have so many feelings. They're teens," Lopez said.
